title: How to Die in Zelda Games

steps.headline: Get a Zelda game.
steps.description: It can be any Zelda game,

steps.headline: Pick a way you want Link to die.
steps.description: There are many ways, and hopefully this guide should cover most of them.

steps.headline: Go to a place that there is lava in (Dodongo's Cavern, Fire Temple etc.
Run into the lava.
In some games Link dies straight away, while in others he must take damage from the lava.
This is only possible in Zelda II, Wind Waker, Phantom Hourglass, Spirit Tracks, Link's Awakening, Oracle of Seasons and Ages, Link to the Past and Minish Cap.
Find some water (the ocean, a river, a lake) which is pretty easy.
Run to the edge of the water and have Link jump in, In Wind Waker Link can swim for a while so keep this in mind..
Repeat this until Link dies.
This is the probably the most known method.
Get within range of them.
Have them use their way of killing Link.
Get to a high place (Death Mountain, Goron City, etc.
Jump off.
If Link doesn't die, repeat until he does.
Go somewhere where you haven't defeated the boss yet.
Do nothing in the boss fight.
steps.description: Don't raise your shield or attack.

steps.headline: Wait for the boss to destroy Link.
This is nearly the same as water, but you cannot do this in the DS games, and you can do this in Ocarina of Time or Twilight Princess.
Put on the Iron Boots (you must be adult Link and you must have no Zora Tunic on).
Go to a body of water (Lake Hylia, Zora's Domain, etc.
Sink into the water and wait for two minutes for Link to drown.
Congratulations, you have successfully killed Link.
Bombs can be thrown by certain enemies or Link can use them himself.
Select the Bombs, then place them in front of Link and wait until they blow up.
Repeat until Link dies.

text: Steps Get a Zelda game. It can be any Zelda game, Pick a way you want Link to die. There are many ways, and hopefully this guide should cover most of them. Lava Go to a place that there is lava in (Dodongo's Cavern, Fire Temple etc. ). Run into the lava.  In some games Link dies straight away, while in others he must take damage from the lava.  Water This is only possible in Zelda II, Wind Waker, Phantom Hourglass, Spirit Tracks, Link's Awakening, Oracle of Seasons and Ages, Link to the Past and Minish Cap.  Find some water (the ocean, a river, a lake) which is pretty easy.  Run to the edge of the water and have Link jump in, In Wind Waker Link can swim for a while so keep this in mind..  Repeat this until Link dies.  Enemies This is the probably the most known method.  Get within range of them.  Have them use their way of killing Link.  Gravity Get to a high place (Death Mountain, Goron City, etc. ). Jump off.  If Link doesn't die, repeat until he does.  Boss fights Go somewhere where you haven't defeated the boss yet.  Do nothing in the boss fight. Don't raise your shield or attack. Wait for the boss to destroy Link.  Drowning This is nearly the same as water, but you cannot do this in the DS games, and you can do this in Ocarina of Time or Twilight Princess.  Put on the Iron Boots (you must be adult Link and you must have no Zora Tunic on).  Go to a body of water (Lake Hylia, Zora's Domain, etc. ). Sink into the water and wait for two minutes for Link to drown.  Congratulations, you have successfully killed Link. Well done. Bombs Bombs can be thrown by certain enemies or Link can use them himself.  Select the Bombs, then place them in front of Link and wait until they blow up.  Repeat until Link dies.
